intro: Pimpinella tragioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Pimpinella tragioides is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
